Abstract
Aiming at the current challenges of enormous scale, complex structure, difficult control and frequent accidents of city gas
high-pressure pipeline network, there are still three aspects of difficulties in the risk monitoring and control of China's
city gas high-pressure pipeline network, namely, rough data, shallow assessment, and lack of power. This paper proposes
an intelligent management system for gas pipelines based on C/S model and J2EE enterprise-level framework, in which
the failure warning models of gas leakage, Gaussian plume diffusion, and fire and explosion are established. And the
Kalman filter algorithm improved by DS evidence theory is used for intelligent fusion of Multi-source data, analyzing
and screening the unified adequate information on data types, extracting state characteristics, classifying warning levels,
and developing an integrated and visualized pipeline remote diagnosis and warning platform. In the simulation of the
intelligent management system of gas pipeline, when the wind speed is 1.5m/s in winter, the ground surface is a safe area
within 12.15m of the gas pipeline. When the maximum wind speed is 10m/s, the upper limit distance of the gas leading
to fire and explosion is only 2.43m, and the hazardous range of the gas pipeline jet fire is within 12.69m. Relying on the
gas high-pressure pipeline network in L city for practical experiments and applications, it provides technical support and
decision-making basis for the construction of intelligent pipeline network, comprehensively improves the risk control
capability of city gas high-pressure pipeline network, and has reference significance for the risk control of national city
gas high-pressure pipeline network.
Keywords: Gas leakage model; Gaussian plume model; DS evidence theory; Kalman filter algorithm; Multi-source
data fusion; Gas pipeline.

1 Introduction
With the acceleration of urbanization, the safe and efficient operation of gas pipelines, as an important
part of urban infrastructure, is crucial [1]. Traditional gas pipeline management methods have
limitations in data processing and risk prediction. Therefore, it is particularly important to research
and develop an intelligent management system for gas pipelines based on Multi-source data fusion
[2-3]. The system aims to improve the efficiency and safety of pipeline management by integrating
and analyzing various data sources.
There are various data sources involved in gas pipeline management, including but not limited to
pipeline pressure, flow, and temperature data, geographic information system (GIS) data, and real-
time monitoring data from sensors [4-6]. The fusion of data from multiple sources can provide a more
comprehensive view of the system and help assess the operational status and potential risks of
pipelines more accurately [7]. An efficient, intelligent gas pipeline management system usually
includes several key components, including data collection, data storage, data analysis, and decision
support [8-10]. The system should be able to collect and process data from various sensors and
databases in real-time, utilize advanced data analysis techniques (e.g., machine learning and artificial
intelligence) to perform risk assessment and prediction, and provide effective decision support [11].
Intelligent management systems for gas pipelines with Multi-source data fusion are of great
significance in improving the safety of city gas supply, optimizing resource allocation, and reducing
operation and maintenance costs [12-13]. With the further development of technology, such systems
are expected to be more intelligent and able to provide more accurate risk assessment and more
effective O&M decision support. The research and development of an intelligent management system
of gas pipelines with Multi-source data fusion is of great practical significance for improving the
safety and operational efficiency of urban gas pipelines [14-16]. With the continuous development
and improvement of related technologies, such systems will play an increasingly important role in
the field of intelligent management of gas pipelines [17-18].
This paper adopts the C/S network architecture and J2EE enterprise application development
framework based on the basic application modules such as process, user, and authority management
to establish an intelligent management system for gas pipelines and establish the Database of the
intelligent management system in order to realize a good integration and sharing with other
information systems. In the system, relevant prediction and warning models of gas pipeline failure
are established, i.e., warning models of gas leakage, diffusion, fire and explosion, etc. By means of
the correlation mathematical model of Multi-source data fusion, the Kalman filter algorithm is
improved by the introduction of DS evidence theory, and the data of multiple features are fused. For
the gas pipeline intelligent management system established in this paper, simulation and example
analysis is carried out from multiple perspectives, such as gas pipeline leakage and diffusion hazard
range, jet fire hazard range, explosion consequences in hazardous areas, and prediction and warning
algorithms, respectively.
2 Gas pipeline intelligent management system architecture
In order to strengthen the comprehensive ability to deal with potential accidents in gas pipeline
operation and to establish an emergency response mechanism to quickly and effectively organize
accident rescue and relief in case of emergency, it is important to clarify the responsibilities and
obligations of all levels of personnel in the emergency response. To clarify the responsibilities and
obligations of personnel at all levels in accident emergency response, to protect the lives of employees
and the public, to protect the environment and the company's property, to safeguard public order and
social stability, combined with the actual situation of pipeline operation, the establishment of an

intelligent management system applicable to urban gas pipeline is an inevitable choice. This chapter
establishes the general framework of the intelligent management system of gas pipelines based on
related technology, which provides support for further realizing the intelligent management of urban
gas pipelines.
2.1 Framework of Intelligent Management System for Gas Pipelines
2.1.1 C/S model architecture
C / S pattern architecture appeared in the 1980s; the most typical and popular is a two-tier structure,
one for the client layer, the application program installed in the user's client, and a centralized user
interface with a variety of business logic and processing functions. The second layer is the service
layer; the client user application is connected to the database server through the network. In the C/S
two-tier structure, the client maintains the application program and accesses the Database directly,
the server-side holds all the data, and each client maintains a task connection with the Database. The
client sends a request to the data server through the application program, and the data server responds
to the request to manipulate the data and returns the result to the client. Utilizing C/S mode to carry
out data exchange can quickly realize the data response, making the data operation process more
efficient and faster and providing reliable support for massive data interaction.
2.1.2 General Architecture of Intelligent Management System
City gas pipeline intelligent management system should be based on the unified pipeline professional
database and basic geographic Database as the information source, with enterprise safety production
related standards and norms system as the policy support, using C/S network architecture and J2EE
enterprise-level application development framework, based on the process, the user, rights
management and other basic application modules, to reach the gas pipeline intelligent management
business required for the various functional applications, and Can form a good integration and sharing
with other information systems of the enterprise. As a result, this paper establishes the overall
framework of the city gas pipeline intelligent relationship system, as shown in Figure 1; the overall
structure of the platform consists of five layers, three support systems, and a management system.
The five layers are divided from bottom to top as the basic support layer, application support layer,
business operation layer, decision analysis layer, and strategic target layer, and the three systems
include information security management system, standardization system, and IT control system.

3 Gas pipeline Multi-source data fusion technology
Since the 21st century, the risk-based gas pipeline management model has achieved remarkable
results in safeguarding the intrinsic safety of oil and gas long-distance pipelines and has been widely
recognized internationally. However, in comparison, the city gas pipeline network has many pressure
levels, complex topology, a large number of pipelines, large differences in pipe age, material type,
wide distribution area, complex service environment, and other significant features, its intelligent
management in many aspects of long-distance pipeline and oil and gas pipeline has obvious
differences, can not be copied and transplanted. In the city, gas pipelines contain a variety of different
sources of related data; normalizing these data and achieving database storage are problems that must
be solved. This chapter proposes a Multi-source data fusion method for gas pipeline data and provides
a variety of gas pipeline diagnoses and early warning models to provide technical support for the
realization of intelligent management of gas pipelines.
3.1 Predictive Early Warning Models for Gas Pipe Failure
3.1.1 Gas Leakage Failure Early Warning Models

cracking leakage, and infiltration leakage. Considering that the pressure level of the urban gas
pipeline network is relatively low, according to the size of the pipeline leakage caliber, the pipeline
leakage model is selected, which can basically satisfy the actual needs.
The pipeline leakage model is suitable for cracking leakage, which is often caused by external
interference, overpressure rupture, or geological subsidence. The leakage is characterized by the
direct truncation of the pipeline, 80%~100% of the pipeline cross-sectional area leakage, and
instantaneous leakage of a large amount of pressure is significantly reduced. Since the gas pressure
at the leakage port and the pressure of the surrounding environment do not differ much, the following
equations can be established using the conservation of energy and the conservation of momentum.

3.1.2 Gas diffusion failure early warning models
Gas leakage essentially consists of two processes: jetting and expansion. The diffusion of a gas is
affected by a variety of uncontrollable factors such as gas leakage conditions, gravity, and its
buoyancy, wind speed, wind direction, atmospheric stability, atmospheric humidity, surface
temperature, etc., which are generally categorized into Gaussian plume diffusion model, Gaussian
smoke plume diffusion model, and atmospheric diffusion model under special meteorological
conditions.
When the pipeline gas release time is not less than the diffusion time, the Gaussian plume diffusion
model can be used for Calculation. The use of the Gaussian plume diffusion model is required to have
the following conditions:
1) The range of gas diffusion should be over the flat, unobstructed ground.
2) There is no chemical or other reaction between the gas and the outside world in the process of
diffusion, and there is no phenomenon such as droplet deposition.
3) The rate of gas leakage is assumed to be a constant that does not change.
4) The wind direction is horizontal, and the wind speed is uniform. The center of the cloud moves
at the same speed as the outside wind speed.
5) There is no heat exchange between the gas and the outside air.
6) The variation of some parameters within the cloud or in the cross-section of the cloud plume
conforms to a normal distribution model.

2) Explosion failure warning model
Gas pipeline leakage is a large amount of gas in the air that forms a gas cloud. If the gas cloud
concentration reaches the explosion limit, the surrounding ignition source will detonate the leakage

temperature flame and explosion pressure wave coupled with each other, the explosion shock wave
can drive the propagation path of the gas together with the movement, resulting in a gradual increase
in the range of high-temperature and high-pressure gas impact.

3.2 Correlation mathematical model for Multi-source data fusion
3.2.1 Fundamentals of multi-sensor information fusion
In sensor systems, relying on a single sensor often does not satisfy the accurate detection of a target,
which may lead to large errors or even mistakes, so multiple sensors are needed. If each sensor makes
independent decisions without considering the connection existing between the detection information
of each sensor, not only will the key information be lost, resulting in the waste of massive data
resources, but it will also lead to a drastic increase in the workload of data processing. Therefore, data
from multiple sensors need to be processed and analyzed comprehensively, which is the essence of
multi-sensor information fusion. Multi-sensor information fusion can enhance the discriminative
ability of the system and improve its robustness and reliability.

4 Test and Analysis of Intelligent Management System for Urban Gas Pipelines
The urban gas pipeline is an important hub for supplying living gas, enterprise heat sources, and raw
chemical materials to urban areas. Any accident that occurs in the pipeline may seriously affect
people's production and life and even cause great losses, so it is of great practical significance to carry
out effective, intelligent management of urban gas pipelines. The purpose of studying the intelligent
management of gas pipelines is to provide relevant decision-support information for people to analyze,
judge, prevent, and make decisions for reference and ultimately to minimize the risk. In this chapter,
the simulation test is carried out for the intelligent management system of urban gas pipelines
established in the previous chapter to explore the effectiveness of its application practice.

4.1.2 Scope of Gas Pipe Jet Fire Hazards
Pressurized natural gas forms a jet when it leaks, and if ignited at the leak opening, a jet fire can form.
When the intensity of the heat radiation from the fire is sufficiently high, it can cause surrounding
objects to burn or deform, and the intense heat radiation may cause equipment to burn or even injuries.
The hazardousness of a gas pipeline jet fire is mainly characterized by the flame extent and the radius
of injury caused by thermal radiation. The variation curve of radiation intensity with distance for gas
pipeline jet fire is shown in Figure 6, and the statistics of the range of influence of thermal radiation
from jet fire are shown in Table 2.
In the curve of jet fire occurring during gas pipeline rupture, the overall trend of thermal radiation
energy of jet fire in winter shows a parabola, and the following conclusions can be drawn when the
wind speed is 1m/s and atmospheric stability is D:
1) In the range of 12.69~18.67m from the leakage point, the intensity of thermal radiation is
more than 5kW/m 2. T here is no special requirement for the equipment in this radiation intensity,
but it will cause harm to the personnel, so the staff who are active in this area need to wear
professional radiation protective clothing.
2) from the leakage point 0 ~ 12.69m, the intensity of thermal radiation exceeding 13.5kW/m 2
the radiation intensity should be avoided within the wooden equipment; radiation to personnel
more than 20 will cause human burns and need close attention.
3) The intensity of thermal radiation of jet fire caused by the rupture of the city gas pipeline will
not exceed 39.55kW/m 2 .
Based on the above results, it is clear that the overall winter gas pipeline rupture failure accidents are
caused by losses compared to the summer, and the maximum wind speed is low, the focus of the gas
pipeline needs to be carried out in the summer for timely maintenance, as a way to better avoid gas
pipeline rupture accidents that may occur in the summer.

4.2.1 Calculation and analysis of the consequences of explosions in hazardous areas
In order to further clarify the role of the gas pipeline intelligent management system established in
this paper in the monitoring of gas leakage, this paper further simulates the leakage caused by the
negligence of personnel who forget to close the gas valve. Calculate the TNT equivalent under
different leakage times so as to clarify the possible explosion risk, the shock wave generated after the
explosion overpressure, and the hazardous radius area division. Table 3 shows the variation of each
parameter under different leakage events of the gas valve.
As can be seen from the table, as the gas leakage time continues to increase, the TNT equivalent
generated in the explosion is also greater; when the gas leakage event from 10s to 5000s, the TNT
equivalent increased from 0.005kg to 0.6285kg, the increase has reached 1256 times. The increase in
leakage time due to the gas explosion and the shock wave generated by the overpressure from
13.76Kpa to 815.92Kpa in the same location, under the different leakage times generated by the shock
wave, is growing. The longer the gas leakage time, the greater the shock wave overpressure, which
reflects the earlier the gas pipeline leakage can be found to minimize the losses generated by the
explosion, which reflects the benefits of an intelligent management system for gas pipelines. At the
same time, as the gas pipeline leakage time increases, the radius of the hazardous area has become
larger and larger; some of the original Scope of the no longer dead zone has gradually become a dead
zone, and the hazardous area is further expanding. Based on the above analysis, it is clear that timely
detection of gas pipeline leakage can effectively avoid the losses caused by the explosion; relying on
the gas pipeline intelligent management system established in this paper can fully access the operation
of the gas pipeline so that the gas pipeline in the early stage of leakage can be effectively controlled.

5 Conclusion
In this paper, the C/S network architecture and J2EE enterprise-level application development
framework are used to establish an intelligent management system for gas pipelines, and the data of
the prediction and warning model related to the failure of gas pipelines are fused by Multi-source data
fusion technology, and the system is simulated and empirically analyzed. The conclusions are as
follows:
1) in the simulation of a gas pipeline failure accident, a winter wind speed of 1.5m/s at the surface
from the gas pipeline outside the range of 12.15m belongs to the safe area, and when the
maximum wind speed of 10m/s, the upper limit distance of fire and explosion caused by the
rupture of the gas pipeline is only 2.43m, and the hazardous range of the gas pipeline jet fire
is within the range of 12.69m. Using the gas pipeline intelligent management system
established in this paper can clarify the parameters related to gas pipeline failure accidents and
help emergency management personnel visualize the data before the development of the
appropriate emergency plan to reduce the losses due to gas pipeline leakage fully.
2) with the gas leakage time increases, the TNT equivalent generated in the explosion, shock
wave overpressure, and the radius of the hazardous area is also larger; when the gas leakage
time is more than 3,000s, the shock wave overpressure of up to 815.92KPa, the radius of the
area of serious injuries has reached 3.66 m. Relying on this paper's system can give a better
understanding of the operation of the gas pipeline in the gas pipeline leakage. In the early
stage of the gas pipeline leakage, timely measures to repair to better ensure the safety of
people's lives and property.
3) Combined with Multi-source data obtained from the visualization of the chart can be clear gas
pipeline prediction and early warning, the face of different degrees of gas pipeline leakage
will lead to different results in the prediction of the early warning to provide emergency
management personnel with more response time, but also in the end of the accident in a timely
manner to understand the pipeline occurred in the specific problem, in order to further
optimize the quality of pipeline construction.
